- SAG-AFTRA, the union representing film, television and radio workers, said in a statement that the death of Ms. Hutchins was a “preventable” tragedy but that it was “not a failure of duty or a criminal act on the part of any performer.” Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/19/arts/rust-shooting-charges-alec-baldwin.html published on 2023-01-19 16:06:00
correction_response:
This tweet is potentially misleading. The actor in question, Alec Baldwin, did not "accidentally discharge a gun" in the sense of carelessness. He was following the director's instructions during a scene rehearsal and was told the gun did not have live rounds. The union representing film workers has stated that it's not an actor's duty to ensure the functional and mechanical operation of a firearm on a production set. The tragedy was preventable, but not due to a failure of duty or a criminal act on the part of any performer. 
https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/19/arts/rust-shooting-charges-alec-baldwin.html
https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/alec-baldwin-rust-shooting-responsible/story?id=81490389
note_1_text: Alec Baldwin claims he did not discharge the weapon in the incident being referenced. He is facing involuntary manslaughter charges in a still ongoing trial.    https://www.rollingstone.com/tv-movies/tv-movie-news/alec-baldwin-says-he-didnt-pull-trigger-fatal-rust-shooting-1265597/    https://www.cnn.com/2023/01/19/us/santa-fe-alec-baldwin-rust-charged/index.html    Rittenhouse was determined to be acting in self defense. He never "fired into a crowd".    https://apnews.com/article/jury-finds-kyle-rittenhouse-not-guilty-in-kenosha-shootings-27f812ba532d65c044617483c915e4de
note_2_text: Kyle Rittenhouse was charged with murdering people who attacked him and not for firing “into a crowd of protestors”.    “And the men he shot were all attacking him when he pulled the trigger; all were white, and at least two had histories of violence.”    https://nypost.com/2021/11/19/rittenhouse-verdict-should-teach-us-not-to-trust-instant-analysis/

refute_evidences: - “The prosecutor’s contention that an actor has a duty to ensure the functional and mechanical operation of a firearm on a production set is wrong and uninformed,” the union said. “An actor’s job is not to be a firearms or weapons expert.” Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/19/arts/rust-shooting-charges-alec-baldwin.html published on 2023-01-19 16:06:00

- Gun in hand, Baldwin said he and Hutchins began blocking out the scene. She was directing his every move, he said: “Everything is at her direction.” Reference: https://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/alec-baldwin-rust-shooting-responsible/story?id=81490389 published on 2021-12-03 01:00:00

- He appeared on national television , where he said he had been told that the gun did not have live rounds in it, and added that he was only following directions when he pointed it at the cinematographer. “Someone is ​responsible for what happened, and I can’t say who that is, but I know it’s not me,” he said in the interview. Reference: https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/19/arts/rust-shooting-charges-alec-baldwin.html published on 2023-01-19 16:06:00

- Hours after his moment of reflection, Baldwin was holding an antique Colt .45 revolver during a marking rehearsal for the film, when the prop gun discharged a live bullet, killing cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and wounding director Joel Souza.
